locutie.beschrijving: A theological defense of the uniqueness of Christ and Paul's vision for the salvation of Jews and Gentiles, framed by a contemporary controversy in the Reformed Church of America.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher engages with the historical context of Paul's anguish and the metaphorical 'olive tree' imagery.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the uniqueness of Christ and explaining Paul's logic, shifting toward testimony and a call to praise at the end.
voorbeelden: Paul’s vision of cosmic salvation includes exclusion
I am not ordained to preach the gospel because I believe all religions teach the same truth

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Intellectual conviction regarding Christ's uniqueness and a sense of awe at God's plan.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The preacher mentions God creating faith, but the Spirit's specific role in the preaching event is not explicitly invoked.

voorbeelden: There is no other empty tomb
Paul uses the image of the olive tree
The New Testament proclamation... will stand forever
Will you join me in the reading
I admit that it is hard for me to understand this
I want you to know now [my faith]
I may be permitted to make a beginning
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak. The preacher promises his own transparency, but rarely speaks 'in persona Christi' to promise God's grace directly to the listener.

voorbeelden: To him be glory for ever. Amen.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The sermon functions as a lecture/testimony rather than a sacramental act of 'loosing and binding'.

indicatoren: Extensive reporting on a New York Times article
Systematic listing of Paul's vision points
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a theological debate rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

missende_elementen: Direct promise of grace to the specific 'you' of the congregation
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Information about salvation is provided, but the 'event' of being saved in the moment of hearing is deferred.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The sermon describes the concept of mercy but does not perform the act of 'toezegging' (promising it to the hearer).

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Mostly in the context of 'you and I' or quoting Paul's 'do not be proud'.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Paul, the Jews, the Gentiles, and the RCA controversy.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Biblical history and the NYT article.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Theology of inclusion) -> Directive (Stand in awe/Join in praise).
voorbeelden: God is able to make believers out of unbelievers... So do not be proud.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The imperative 'stand in awe' is based on a description of God's power rather than a direct promise of God's favor to the hearer.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: Paul sees God calling the whole world... Will you join me in the reading?

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a 'sermon-teaching' (as the preacher admits). It defends a doctrine against modern dilution but remains in the realm of 'talking about' God.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The distillation of the most truly radical message...
sterke_punten.effect: The hearer understands the theological stakes.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Paul’s vision of cosmic salvation includes exclusion.
zwakke_punten.probleem: It describes a vision rather than enacting it.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon is a lecture on a text rather than a 'speech-event' where God speaks to the soul.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Lacks the 'Promissio' (Toezegging) that characterizes the sermon as a means of grace.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: No. God is the object of the preacher's description.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Partial. He claims his ordination but uses it to testify to his own faith rather than to speak for God.
tekstueel_bewijs: I am not ordained to preach... because I believe...

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher hopes he is 'permitted to make a beginning,' but doesn't explicitly yield the effect to the Spirit.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: No. The sermon is treated as a 'bearing witness' or 'sharing news'.
tekstueel_bewijs: It is in the character of Christianity to bear witness.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by 'is', 'means', and 'says'. It needs 'I promise you' and 'God declares to you'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Only one death... has saving power for the whole world.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: This Christ, who died, now washes away your sins by his blood.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a universal fact to a personal application.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The mercy of God is discussed as a 'vision' of Paul.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Directly apply the 'full inclusion' to the congregation.
voorbeeldzinnen: In Christ, God includes you in his eternal mercy today.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'Paul says' and 'The article states'.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use the 'I-Thou' address of the Gospel.
voorbeeldzinnen: Hear the Word of the Lord for you: You are grafted in.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The call to 'stand in awe' feels like a psychological requirement.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Make the awe a result of the declared promise.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is theologically sound and intellectually engaging, but it remains a 'report' on the Gospel rather than the 'event' of the Gospel. To become sacramental, it must move from the third person to the second person.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (his 59 years of faith). SAT reveals this is an 'Expressive' act that lacks the 'Declarative' authority of a divine mandate.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, the NYT hook is excellent. From an SAT perspective, it increases the 'Constative Surplus' by adding more external facts to describe.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT exposes that the preacher is 'talking about' Paul's ecstasy rather than leading the congregation into their own encounter with the Word.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Now if their failure means riches for the Gentiles, how much more will their full inclusion mean!
kernzinnen_analyse.illocutionaire_kracht: Explaining a logical 'how much more' argument.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Good for teaching, low for encounter.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: God is able to make believers out of unbelievers, otherwise you and I would not be here.
kernzinnen_analyse.illocutionaire_kracht: Stating a general truth about God's power.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'talking about the Gospel' (Constative) rather than 'doing the Gospel' (Performative).
